### OPTIONAL COVERS
Applicable if the section(s) are indicated as covered in the Policy Schedule

**Pre-Existing Medical Condition**

#### Section 43a. Overseas Medical Expenses
We will pay You up to the Benefit Limit, for the necessary Overseas Medical Expenses incurred and paid by You, within thirty (30) days from the date of Your first treatment of Your Bodily Injury or Sickness due to a Pre-Existing Medical Condition during the Trip.

This Section is not applicable to Insured Person(s) who are above the age of seventy (70) years old.
questions: How does the policy define the coverage limits and time frame for Overseas Medical Expenses related to Pre-Existing Medical Conditions during a Trip, and what documentation is required to prove the expenses were incurred and paid within the specified period?

In what ways does the age limit of seventy (70) years affect the applicability of the Pre-Existing Medical Condition cover under Section 43a, and how does this interact with any general exclusions related to age or health conditions?

If an Insured Person suffers a Bodily Injury or Sickness from a Pre-Existing Medical Condition during a Trip, how is the thirty (30) day window for claiming Overseas Medical Expenses calculated, and what happens if treatment continues beyond this period?

What are the conditions under which Overseas Medical Expenses for Pre-Existing Medical Conditions are considered necessary and eligible for reimbursement, and how might this be affected by the timing and nature of the medical treatment received during the Trip?

How does the Optional Cover for Pre-Existing Medical Conditions under Section 43a coordinate with other sections of the policy that cover Overseas Medical Expenses, especially in cases where multiple conditions or injuries are treated simultaneously?

What exclusions or limitations apply specifically to the Pre-Existing Medical Condition Optional Cover, and how do these relate to or override any general policy exclusions concerning medical conditions or age?
How does the policy handle claims for Overseas Medical Expenses if the Insured Person is exactly seventy (70) years old at the time of the Trip, considering the exclusion for those above seventy?

What documentation or proof is required to demonstrate that Overseas Medical Expenses were both incurred and paid by the Insured Person within the thirty (30) day period following first treatment for a Pre-Existing Medical Condition during the Trip?

If an Insured Person has a Pre-Existing Medical Condition and incurs medical expenses overseas, how does the policy determine whether these expenses are covered under the Optional Cover or excluded due to the age restriction or other policy terms?

How does the policy define 'first treatment' for a Pre-Existing Medical Condition during the Trip, and what implications does this have for the timing and eligibility of Overseas Medical Expenses claims under Section 43a?

In cases where an Insured Person has multiple Pre-Existing Medical Conditions, how does the policy apply the Benefit Limit and the thirty (30) day claim period for Overseas Medical Expenses under the Optional Cover?

What happens if Overseas Medical Expenses related to a Pre-Existing Medical Condition are incurred but not paid within the thirty (30) day period after first treatment during the Tripâ€”are such claims eligible under Section 43a?

How does the Optional Cover for Pre-Existing Medical Conditions interact with any policy provisions related to quarantine or COVID-19, especially if the medical expenses arise from a Pre-Existing Condition exacerbated by such circumstances?

If an Insured Person is traveling with a Pre-Existing Medical Condition and is hospitalized overseas, how does the policy address the coverage of medical expenses incurred beyond the thirty (30) day limit specified in Section 43a?

How does the policy treat Overseas Medical Expenses for Pre-Existing Medical Conditions if the Trip is extended or automatically extended beyond the original return date, particularly regarding the thirty (30) day claim window?

What are the implications of the Optional Cover's age exclusion on Insured Persons who turn seventy-one (71) during the Trip, and how does this affect claims for Overseas Medical Expenses related to Pre-Existing Medical Conditions?

How does the policy ensure that the Benefit Limit for Overseas Medical Expenses under the Pre-Existing Medical Condition Optional Cover is not exceeded when multiple claims are made within the thirty (30) day period following first treatment?

In what scenarios would Overseas Medical Expenses for Pre-Existing Medical Conditions be denied under Section 43a due to policy-wide General Exclusions, and how do these exclusions interact with the Optional Cover?

How does the policy define a 'Trip' in the context of the Optional Cover for Pre-Existing Medical Conditions, and how might this definition affect the eligibility and timing of claims for Overseas Medical Expenses?

If an Insured Person has a Pre-Existing Medical Condition and receives treatment overseas but also incurs follow-up medical expenses in Singapore within thirty (30) days, how does the policy coordinate coverage and exclusions between overseas and local medical expenses?
